articles.headline: The United States Has Been a Bulwark for Ukraine. What Happens if Support Collapses?
articles.snippet: American officials concede there is nothing on the horizon that could match the power of a new, $60 billion congressional appropriation to support its war against Russian aggression.
articles.abstract: American officials concede there is nothing on the horizon that could match the power of a new, $60 billion congressional appropriation to support its war against Russian aggression.
articles.lead_paragraph: A year ago, when Washington and much of Europe were still awash in optimism that Ukraine was on the verge of repelling Russia from its territory, it seemed inconceivable that the United States would turn its back on the victim of Vladimir V. Putin’s aggression.

articles.headline: Netanyahu Spurns Hamas Offer for Gaza Cease-Fire
articles.snippet: The Israeli prime minister said that the proposed deal would leave Israel vulnerable to attack and that its forces were preparing to expand their operations.
articles.abstract: The Israeli prime minister said that the proposed deal would leave Israel vulnerable to attack and that its forces were preparing to expand their operations.
articles.lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel, dashing hopes that a cease-fire in the Gaza Strip might be close, on Wednesday spurned a proposal from Hamas and said that Israel had directed its forces to prepare to operate in a Gazan city that has become a refuge for more than one million Palestinians.
articles.byline: By Adam Rasgon, Aaron Boxerman, Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Michael Levenson

articles.headline: Construction Industry Grapples With Its Top Killer: Drug Overdose
articles.snippet: Construction workers are more likely to die of overdose than workers in any other occupation, forcing the industry to rethink its approach to safety.
articles.abstract: Construction workers are more likely to die of overdose than workers in any other occupation, forcing the industry to rethink its approach to safety.
articles.lead_paragraph: At One Madison, a high-rise under construction on 23rd Street in Manhattan, workers face dangers daily: live wires, electrical hazards, heavy machinery. Cold gusts of wind whip around them as they lay concrete and operate forklifts. Access to the upper floors of the 28-story building is a ride on a noisy construction elevator.

articles.headline: After Its $20 Billion Windfall Evaporated, a Start-Up Picks Up the Pieces
articles.snippet: Regulatory scrutiny felled the sale of Figma, a design platform, to Adobe. Now it’s grappling with employee expectations and a changing market.
articles.abstract: Regulatory scrutiny felled the sale of Figma, a design platform, to Adobe. Now it’s grappling with employee expectations and a changing market.
articles.lead_paragraph: On Dec. 18, a $20 billion deal by Adobe, the software giant, to buy Figma, a San Francisco start-up darling, fell apart after more than a year of regulatory scrutiny.

articles.headline: Big Dreams Come Back to Bite New York Community Bank
articles.snippet: Acquiring billions of dollars in assets from Signature Bank when it went under last year contributed to the Long Island lender’s troubles.
articles.abstract: Acquiring billions of dollars in assets from Signature Bank when it went under last year contributed to the Long Island lender’s troubles.
articles.lead_paragraph: During last spring’s banking crisis, when a competing lender went under, New York Community Bank pounced, acquiring a big chunk of its business. Now, it is paying dearly for that decision.
articles.byline: By Rob Copeland and Emily Flitter

articles.headline: Supreme Court Seems Likely to Reject Challenge to Trump’s Eligibility
articles.snippet: Justices across the ideological spectrum expressed skepticism about several aspects of a ruling from the Colorado Supreme Court, but there was little discussion of the Jan. 6 riot or Mr. Trump’s role in it.
articles.abstract: Justices across the ideological spectrum expressed skepticism about several aspects of a ruling from the Colorado Supreme Court, but there was little discussion of the Jan. 6 riot or Mr. Trump’s role in it.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court seemed poised on Thursday to issue a lopsided decision rejecting a challenge to former President Donald J. Trump’s eligibility to hold office again.

articles.headline: American Firms Invested $1 Billion in Chinese Chips, Lawmakers Find
articles.snippet: A congressional investigation determined that U.S. funding helped fuel the growth of a sector now viewed by Washington as a security threat.
articles.abstract: A congressional investigation determined that U.S. funding helped fuel the growth of a sector now viewed by Washington as a security threat.
articles.lead_paragraph: A congressional investigation has determined that five American venture capital firms invested more than $1 billion in China’s semiconductor industry since 2001, fueling the growth of a sector that the United States government now regards as a national security threat.
articles.byline: By Ana Swanson and Erin Griffith

articles.headline: Bolsonaro and Allies Planned a Coup, Brazil Police Say
articles.snippet: Brazilian federal police raided former government officials and ordered the former president to hand in his passport over accusations that they tried to overturn the 2022 election.
articles.abstract: Brazilian federal police raided former government officials and ordered the former president to hand in his passport over accusations that they tried to overturn the 2022 election.
articles.lead_paragraph: Former President Jair Bolsonaro of Brazil oversaw a broad conspiracy to hold on to power regardless of the results of the 2022 election, including personally editing a proposed order to arrest a Supreme Court justice, according to accusations unveiled on Thursday by the Brazilian federal police.

articles.headline: Kansas City Stars, With Help From Taylor Swift, Are Advertising Champs
articles.snippet: On-field success and a certain off-field relationship helped make Patrick Mahomes, Travis Kelce and Andy Reid ubiquitous on TV commercials during the N.F.L. season.
articles.abstract: On-field success and a certain off-field relationship helped make Patrick Mahomes, Travis Kelce and Andy Reid ubiquitous on TV commercials during the N.F.L. season.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Kansas City Chiefs enter Sunday’s Super Bowl having already won — when it comes to commercials.
